thread.title: Bangui paralysed by violence, mass escape
thread.title_full: Bangui paralysed by violence, mass escape | News24

author: news24.com
title: Bangui paralysed by violence, mass escape
text:
Bangui - Tension and fear on Monday gripped Bangui, the capital of Central African Republic, with the city's main streets closed by barricades after a spate of violence, looting and the death of three protesters.
A hospital source told AFP on condition of anonymity the three were killed and seven were injured on Monday when UN peacekeepers opened fire as several hundred protesters headed for the presidency. The UN mission issued a denial.
The demonstrators were demanding the resignation of interim leader Catherine Samba Panza after the deaths of at least 20 people in Bangui at the weekend. She was in New York attending the UN General Assembly session.
The shooting was also seen by a witness, who spoke to AFP, also on condition of not being named.
